website_summaries.verdict: A low-profile, weather-resistant full-HD action camera, the Drift Stealth 2 isn't without compromises, but makes up for them in size and usability.
pros: The Drift Stealth 2 is a very compact, lightweight splash-proof action camera with a rotating lens that makes it possible to mount just about anywhere
On-board controls and a small LCD let you change modes and settings without connecting to a second device
cons: While the battery lasts fairly long, it is built-in, so no swapping in a fresh pack to keep shooting
Its screen won't let you preview or review your shots

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera about 18 months ago and have had good luck with it until now. When the battery fails it will lose it's full charge in about 10 seconds. It uses a 3.7 volt, 1500maH lithium polymer battery (Kayo KPL 103443) that IS NOT user replaceable. That fact does not bother me since by profession I repair broadcast video equipment, but this particular battery seems to be a proprietary battery sourced only for manufacturing this model camera. It is not available to the public and even using my resources I have been unable to find a replacement. Drift Innovations just might answer your emails but they have absolutely no real customer service or repair service.
customer_reviews.author: Beanman

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, but corrupt files make it less than useful.

However, I have had corrupt files (unable to read) which means useless if it happens at a time of an accident or something that needs to be recorded. Also, the wi-fi viewing on the phone is not working well. I would not buy this model again. I need a camera I can trust, this isn't it. Edit-Too many corrupt files to make the camera usable. Seller will not work with me on return authorization, even though Drift authorized it. Camera is obsolete, so I have no choice but refund.

customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best option for cycle commuting
customer_reviews.text: Posting this after 3 months of daily commuting. The camera is mounted on the handlebar with the Minoura mount. I have to remove camera every day so the mounting options that come with the camera are pretty much uselles for me. Otherwise camera fit the bill, small, waterproof without a case, 3 hours battery, good video footage and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: sampionzh

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it, lasted 6 months, back came off on a long ride in the rain and broke. Thought this was my fault so I replaced it with another out of my own pocket. Software entirely failed. Got a replacement, this also broke - simular issue - after 5 weeks, so I gave up with headcameras while i ride my motorbike. Now, I have had an accident on my motorbike, with no supporting video footage as evidence. Moral of the story. Spend the extra money, get a go pro, keep your no-claims bonus. Its a financial no brainer. This is without a doubt the worst purchase I have ever made.
customer_reviews.author: J M Kleiner

customer_reviews.title: Great headcam
customer_reviews.text: I've used this in-car, canoeing and cycling. People are wowed by the picture quality when they see the playback. Sleek, compact design and lots of functions. It's very robust too. Better than a GoPro in my opinion and cheaper. May need to purchase the helmet mounting kit for some cycling helmets, especially if they are heavily vented or contoured. This is rather expensive at £25, hence four, rather than five stars. But having said that, it's a lot of fun and worth purchasing the well-engineered waterproof case for watersports.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for recording journies on my motorbike. A number of mounts included and you can download an app to remotely control it too. Great quality pictures and film as well as seeming like it's pretty watertight from the off although in order to submerge it completely you'll need and additional case.
customer_reviews.author: g_shaw1984

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bit of kit for bikers
customer_reviews.text: I'd considered getting a decent helmet cam for ages and finally plumped for this - and very glad I did, it's excellent! Good quality recording, nice, clear and effective menu system, the only drawbacks are wind noise (I now run with mic off) and having to take the back off to charge it - runs for about 2.5 hours on a charge in my experience so far, bit of a bind on a day out! It's very easy to set up and use - I also bought the remote but find I never use it as manual control is so easy, so save your money on that!
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Biker
customer_reviews.text: This is one fantastic little HD camera & at 90 grams it sits secure on the side of my helmet (the 3M sticky pads are really good). Footage is amazingly clear & perfect for safety reasons when commuting to work on the bike, battery life is good too. At £90 it's a steal & highly recommended - Very Impressed.
customer_reviews.author: AndyP

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the money. Hard to get hold of this product so was pleased that I got delivery so quickly on Amazon. My partner has had a drift stealth 2 for about 15 months with no issues. Tried this over the weekend and is spot on. Captures everything and will give me peace of mind when out on my motorbike. Picture quality is great. Battery life as described. Really easy to mount to helmet and set up simple.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If like me, you spend most of the time wanting ...
customer_reviews.text: Five stars simply because I plugged it into my laptop and the videos uploaded after just two prompted clicks. If like me, you spend most of the time wanting to destroy all technology with a hammer, this will do. Okay it's not perfect (the mic picks up too much wind noise and the battery only lasts 3 hours) but to cover your arse when some lesser road user decides not to bother looking, it works just fine. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Rik

customer_reviews.title: It wont turn on!!! HELP!!
customer_reviews.text: Since i got this beauty iv only had the chance to use it 5 times and its now dead, it wont turn on, even when i plug in the charger now i dont know what to do as the return-by date has passed. Please help
customer_reviews.author: kwasi Pim-Wusu

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted:-(
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok when it did although wind noise is a pain. Picture quality pretty good. Mine packed up soon after warranty ran out, didn’t really have much use so disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Had this for around 4 weeks now. Easy to use, quite small and light. It's fitted to a motorbike helmet and I hardly notice it's there. Quality is pretty good, although when traveling at speed the sound recording is not much use. Would be nice if it could support bigger than 32G SD card.
customer_reviews.author: MiNK

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: So far delighted with this. Use it as a motorcycle helmet camera. Video footage is good bit not quite as good as a GoPro but I knew that would be the case. Looks small and onubtrusive on my lid and the rotating lenses is excellent as on first fitting the footage was slightly of level so a small turn of the lense and it's perfect now.
customer_reviews.author: M Graves

customer_reviews.title: Very small lightweight camera.
customer_reviews.text: Very good value if you want to just 'keep a record' for safety purposes. The lack of an internal mic lets it down as an all rounder but it's exceptionally small and light and excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: but the main issue is the connection to recharge the camera is poor, and i have to wrap a rubber band ...
customer_reviews.text: The battery doesnt last as long as long as id hoped, but the main issue is the connection to recharge the camera is poor, and i have to wrap a rubber band around the camera and wire at a certain angle for it to recharge. Quality of the camera video is excellant.
customer_reviews.author: Home Owner !

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera after it was recommended. Turned to be a waste of money. Battery packs in at 50% and stops recording. Therefore you get about 40mins worth max. No use for extended recording. Raised it with Drift who couldn't care less. Camera has now been discontinued. Wonder why? As there is no access to battery you are left with a pretty useless camera.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: works great, fairly good quality, only problem is that the mic just records wind noise, but not really worried about audio unless talking to someone. LED stopped working for some reason but doesn't effect overall good quality and cam works ok.
customer_reviews.author: SteveKH

customer_reviews.title: Saved my bum!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a dashcam user for years and so when I got a bike I bought this camera just helped me to prove I was not at fault in a accident. Well worth the £99 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Coventry

customer_reviews.title: Mounts are Bad
customer_reviews.text: Only Three Stars... The reason being, the camera quality is good it looks nice. but, this morning i dropped my crash helmet from knee height (Camera was Mounted on the side) and the mount fell off. so i don't know how it is meant to stay on at anything more than 40 Mph so i will be purchasing some new mounts just so it can be used. i would Recommend this product although I would not risk using the mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Rolo_1997

customer_reviews.title: Steath 2
customer_reviews.text: I quite like this little camera. I use it most days and find it reliable and easy to use. Battery life seems good. No external microphone so stuck with built in microphone which picks up wind noise. Shame it doesn't come with remote but it is the cheaper option compared to the Ghost S, so not going to hold that against it as it's available separately if you want it.
customer_reviews.author: ThirdDeepLens
